Turtle.colourTooltip: Changes the color of the pen.
Turtle.jumpForwardTooltip: Moves the turtle forward without leaving any marks.
Turtle.moveTooltip: Moves the turtle forward or backward by the specified amount.
Turtle.penTooltip: Lifts or lowers the pen, to start or stop drawing.
Turtle.turnRightTooltip: Turns the turtle right by the specified angle.
Turtle.turnTooltip: Turns the turtle left or right by the specified number of degrees.
Turtle.turtleVisibilityTooltip: Makes the turtle (green circle and arrow) visible or invisible.
Turtle.widthTooltip: Changes the width of the pen.
Turtle.notBlackColour: You need to set a color other than black for this level.
Turtle.tooFewColours: You need to use at least %1 different colors on this level.  You used only %2.
Turtle.wrongColour: Your picture is the wrong color.  For this level, it needs to be %1.
Turtle.title: CS First: Turtle Graphics %1
Turtle.numBlocksNeeded: This level can be solved with %1 blocks.  You used %2.
Turtle.instructions1_1: I'm a turtle with chalk on my belly. Stack up blocks and press "Run Program" to make me draw the shown picture.
Turtle.instructions1_2: Draw a square, making each side a different color.
Turtle.instructions1_3: Make a square using only 3 blocks.  (Remember that blocks to set color are free.)
Turtle.instructions1_4: Draw a triangle whose sides are all 100 pixels and are in random colors.  You'll have to figure out how far to turn.
Turtle.instructions1_5: Draw a triangle and then a square to draw an envelope.
Turtle.instructions1_6: Can you figure out how draw this triangle and square?
Turtle.instructions1_7: See if you can draw these green glasses.
Turtle.instructions1_8: After trying out these blocks, see what happens if you make them repeat 8 times.  It should look a little different every time you run it.
Turtle.instructions1_9: Figure out what number to replace the question marks with to draw a circle.
Turtle.instructions1_10: Draw anything you want. Some ideas are a stick figure, snowflake, or spiral.  You could also try out the new "set width" block.  Have fun!
Turtle.instructions2_1: Find the familiar blocks in the new categories to draw a square in your favorite color.
Turtle.instructions2_2: Use the new "draw a square" block, found in the "Functions" category, to draw a small green square.
Turtle.instructions2_3: Use the new block to draw 3 squares of size 100, each 120 degrees apart, in random colors.
Turtle.instructions2_4: Now change the code to draw 36 squares, each 10 degrees apart.
Turtle.instructions2_5: Draw squares with sides of 50, 60, 70, 80, and 90 pixels.  You'll need lots of blocks.
Turtle.instructions2_6: Modify this program to get the value of counter (in the Variables category) when drawing a square instead of the value 10.
Turtle.instructions2_7: Replace the pale (disabled) blocks with a "count with" block to draw the same spiral.
Turtle.instructions2_8: Draw three snowmen 150 dots tall in different colors, 100 dots apart.  Use the new "draw a snowman" function and "jump forward" block.
Turtle.instructions2_9: Use a "count with" loop to draw a family of snowmen with heights of 110, 100, 90, 80, and 70 dots, each 60 dots apart.
Turtle.instructions2_10: Draw whatever you want.  One idea is experimenting with different types of spirals.  What happens if you change the turn amount, rather than the move amount?  TODO: Add starting blocks.
Turtle.instructions3_1: You can now see how the "draw a square" and "draw a circle" functions are defined.  Defining a function doesn't run its blocks.  You have to pull out the "draw a square" block to actually draw a square.
Turtle.instructions3_2: Using the "draw a square" function as an example, create a "draw a triangle" function and use it.
Turtle.instructions3_3: Draw triangular fences around the cats and a square fence around the cow.  Tip: Test the program as you go along.
Turtle.instructions3_4: See if you can figure out how to use "draw a square" and "draw a triangle" (and some other blocks) to draw a house around the lion.
Turtle.instructions3_5: Now create a "draw a house" function and use it house two cats.
Turtle.instructions3_6: Using "draw a square" as an example, add an input named "length" to "draw a triangle".  Then, draw triangles in different colors around the animals.
Turtle.instructions3_7: Add a "length" input to "draw a house" and build a big house for the elephant.
Turtle.instructions3_8: Here are all of the blocks from the previous level.  Modify "draw a house" so the turtle ends up at the bottom right corner of the new house.  Use this modified function to house all the animals.
Turtle.instructions3_9: Use a "count with" block and your code from the previous level to draw houses of size 50, 100, and 150.
Turtle.instructions3_10: You're now free to do whatever you want.  One idea is to try running this program with different turn amounts (higher or lower than 90).  Other ideas are to draw a star, circle, heart, or animal.
Turtle.nextLevel: Congratulations! You have completed this level.
Turtle.finalLevelMsg: Congratulations! You have solved the final level.
BlocklyApps.moveForwardError1Msg: You'll need to move me forward in order to draw anything.
BlocklyApps.moveForwardError2Msg: You need to use the "move forward" block.
BlocklyApps.moveError1Msg: You'll need to move me in order to draw anything.
BlocklyApps.moveError2Msg: You need to use the "move" block.
Turtle.moveForwardError1Msg: I'll need to turn in order to draw this picture.
Turtle.moveForwardError2Msg: I'll need to turn right by 90 degrees to draw this picture.
Turtle.turnError1Msg: I'll need to turn in order to draw this picture.
Turtle.repeatError1Msg: The "repeat" block saves you from having to repeat yourself.
Turtle.repeatError2Msg: You need to use a "repeat" block.
Turtle.colour_randomError1Msg: The "set color" and "random color" blocks give you random (unpredictable) colors.
Turtle.colour_randomError2Msg: Pull out the "set color" block that contains a "random color" block, and put it in the appropriate place.
Turtle.drawColourError1Msg: To change the color I draw, use the "set color" block.
Turtle.drawColourError2Msg: Each "set color" block sets the color of everything I draw after it until the next "set color" block.
Turtle.forError1Msg-p2-l6: Reload this level to get the "count with" block back.
Turtle.forError1Msg-p2-l7: You need a "count with" block to give the counter values from 25 through 60.
Turtle.forError1Msg-p2-l9: You need a "count with" block to give the counter values from 110 down to 70.
Turtle.forError2Msg-p2-l7: Open the Loops category, and drag out a "count with" block.
Turtle.forError2Msg-p2-l9: Open the Loops category, and drag out a "count with" block. Have it count from 110 to 70 by 10.
Turtle.getCounterError1Msg-p2-l6: You need the "counter" block to draw squares of different lengths.
Turtle.getCounterError1Msg-p2-l7: You need the "counter" block to draw lines of different lengths.
Turtle.getCounterError1Msg-p2-l9: You need the "counter" block to draw snowmen of different heights.
Turtle.getCounterError2Msg-p2-l6: From the "Variables" category, get the "counter" block, and use it as the "length" input to "draw a square".
Turtle.getCounterError2Msg-p2-l7: From the "Variables" category, get the "counter" block, and use it as the input to the "move forward" block.
Turtle.getCounterError2Msg-p2-l9: From the "Variables" category, get the "counter" block, and use it as the input to the "draw a snowman" block.
Turtle.draw_a_snowmanError1Msg: You need to use the "draw a snowman" block.
Turtle.draw_a_snowmanError2Msg: You can get the "draw a snowman" block from the "Functions" category.
Turtle.jumpError1Msg: The "jump forward" block moves the turtle without drawing anything.
Turtle.jumpError2Msg: Open the Actions category to Get the "jump forward" block, and use it to move the turtle between each snowman.
Turtle.drawASquareError1Msg-p2: In this tutorial, to draw a square, use the new "draw a square" function.
Turtle.drawASquareError2Msg-p2: Open the Functions category and get a "draw a square" block.
Turtle.drawASquareError1Msg-p3: The shown code tells the turtle <x id='START_EMPHASIS'/>how<x id='END_EMPHASIS'/> to draw a square but not to draw a square.  You need to pull out a "draw a square" block from the Functions category.
Turtle.drawASquareError2Msg-p3: From the current code, the turtle doesn't know that you want to draw a square. Pull out a "draw a square" block from the Functions category.
Turtle.drawATriangleError1Msg-p3: You need a "draw a triangle" block to let the turtle know you want it to draw a triangle.
Turtle.drawATriangleError2Msg-p3: To use your "draw a triangle" function, open the "Functions" category and pull out a "draw a triangle" block.
Turtle.triangleDefErrorMsg1: Oops.  It looks like you no longer have a block to tell the turtle how to draw a triangle.  Try reloading the page.
Turtle.triangleDefErrorMsg2: Reload the page to get back the "to draw a triangle" block.
Turtle.defineAnythingErrorMsg1: You need to create a function.
Turtle.defineAnythingErrorMsg2: Open the Functions category, and pull out a "do something" block, and fill it in.
Turtle.defineDrawAHouseErrorMsg1: The function you create must be named "draw a house".
Turtle.defineDrawAHouseErrorMsg2: Put "draw a house" in the light purple area of the "to do something" block you dragged out.
Turtle.drawAHouseError1Msg: Now that you created a "draw a house" function, you need to call it.
Turtle.drawAHouseError2Msg: Open the Functions category, and pull out a "draw a house" block.
Turtle.triangleDefWithParameterErrorMsg1: You need to add a "length" input to your function definition. The first step is clicking on the blue "+" next to "to draw a triangle".
Turtle.triangleDefWithParameterErrorMsg2: Your "draw a triangle" function needs a "length" input. Click on the blue "+" next to "to draw a triangle", drag in an input, and name it "length".
Turtle.triangleDefWithLengthParameterErr: You added an input to "draw a triangle".  Now you need to change its name to "length".
Click on the blue "+" next to "to draw a triangle" and change the name of the input to "length".
Turtle.moveByLengthMsg1: The amount to move forward should depend on the input "length".
Turtle.moveByLengthMsg2: Open the Variables category, and drag a "length" block into the "move forward" block.
Turtle.triangleCallWithParameterErrorMsg: When using the "draw a triangle" block, you need to provide an input that says how big the triangle should be.
Open the Math category, and pull out a number block.  Change its value and plug it into the "draw a triangle" block to say how big the first triangle should be.
Maze.tooFewBlocksMsg: You are using all of the necessary types of blocks, but you'll need more blocks to complete this level.
Turtle.levelIncompleteError: You are using all of the necessary types of blocks but not in the right way.
